intro: Miconia verticalis, commonly known as the upright miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Miconia verticalis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
